title: 8 Cash-Rich Stocks for a Topsy-Turvy Market
text: While it’s tempting to pile your money into high-flying investments, cash-rich companies are the best stocks to buy in unpredictable markets.

title: Facebook's earliest employees say Zuckerberg's inaction on Trump posts is 'cowardly'
text: Nearly three dozen of Facebook's earliest employees wrote an open letter addressing Facebook's leadership Wednesday calling for the company to rethink its inaction on recent incendiary posts by President Donald Trump.

title: Early Facebook staffers denounce Zuckerberg stance on Trump posts
text: Nearly three dozen former employees from Facebook's early days on Wednesday blasted Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's decision not to act against incendiary posts by U.S. President Donald Trump as "cowardly" and a "betrayal" of company ideals.

title: Key Words: Some of the people who literally helped write Facebook’s community standards say Zuckerberg is wrong on Trump posts
text: Nearly three dozen former Facebook Inc. employees, dismayed with Mark Zuckerberg’s hands-off policy on President Donald Trump’s posts and his defensive posture on the matter, forcefully pushed back in a stinging letter released Wednesday.

title: Zuckerberg faces growing backlash from outraged Facebook employees
text: Facebook Founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg defended his stance on Trump, but admitted his inaction hurt the social media giant.

title: Facebook's new Oversight Board isn't operational yet and won't review Trump's 'shooting starts' posts
text: Facebook's Oversight Board, an independent body that can overturn the company's own content moderation decisions, announced on Wednesday that it is not yet operational, so won't review a controversial post from President Donald Trump that the company has refused to take down or moderate.

title: Zuckerberg's stance on Trump posts criticized by former Facebook staffers, report says
text: An open letter reportedly calls the CEO's position a "betrayal."

title: Early Facebook Employees Disavow Zuckerberg’s Stance on Trump Posts
text: In an open letter, nearly three dozen called on the chief executive to take action on President Trump’s messages.

title: Will Position on Trump’s Posts Hurt Facebook Stock?
text: Despite intense criticism, Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg is standing by his decision not to remove or add a warning label to a controversial post by President Donald Trump that has been viewed by many people as a threat of violence.

title: The narratives Facebook uses to keep its employees happy are crumbling
text: Facebook’s lenient policy toward toxic Donald Trump posts has some of its employees looking at their employer with new eyes this week.

title: Facebook’s Stock (FB) is Poised to Make New Highs
text: One of our top technical stock ideas here is Facebook (FB). The stock closed yesterday (Tuesday) at $232.72.

title: Facebook, PayPal Invest in Indonesia's Gojek
text: Facebook said the investment dovetails with its mission to serve small businesses and bring them into the digital economy.

title: Long-term Facebook investor hopes for governance overhaul of the company
text: Internal controversy at Facebook is escalating as employees express disappointment in Mark Zuckerberg's leadership.

title: Facebook suspends white nationalist accounts over protest threats
text: Facebook has suspended accounts linked to white nationalist groups amid raging protests against racism and police brutality. Some of those accounts urged people to bring weapons to recent demonstrations following last week’s police killing of George Floyd, according to Facebook.

title: Zuckerberg defends his decision on content moderation amid employee outrage
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is used to facing irate lawmakers, but now he's facing outraged employees over company policies and he's defending his actions.

title: Zuckerberg Defends ‘Do Nothing’ Approach On Trump, Admits Inaction Hurt Facebook
text: Zuckerberg admitted a number of failings during the meeting with employees, including the fact that just one black employee was privy to Facebook’s decision to leave Trump’s controversial post up.

title: Facebook and Microsoft muscle in on Zoom video-call boom
text: Google also aims to be part of rise in teleconferencing during coronavirus crisis

title: 5 Brand-Name Stocks That Can Make You Rich
text: Don't let their large market caps fool you -- these well-known companies have plenty left in the tank.

title: Facebook suspends white nationalist groups encouraging ambushes of George Floyd protests
text: Facebook has suspended a number of accounts associated with white nationalist groups after they advocated bringing weapons to ongoing protests in the US.

title: Facebook, PayPal Join Google As Investors In Indonesian Tech Giant GoJek
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) and PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: PYPL) have invested in Indonesian ride-hailing giant GoJek, TechCrunch reported Tuesday.

title: Zuckerberg Tells Facebook Employees He's Not Going To Moderate Trump
text: Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB), told employees at a Tuesday virtual all-hands meeting that he was firm on not moderating a post by President Donald Trump about protests against the killing of George Floyd.

title: Facebook strikes global licensing deal with Indian music label Saregama
text: Facebook said on Wednesday it has entered into a global deal with Saregama, one of India’s oldest music labels, to license its music for video and other social experiences across its marquee and Instagram services.
